question.para: configure can't guess my host type.

answer.para: Typical symptoms look like this: sk ~/tmp-0.0 $ ./configure creating cache ./config.cache checking host system type... configure: error: can not guess host type; you must specify one sk ~/tmp-0.0 $
The problem is usually that the script can't run the compiler. Usually it's just a missing /usr/bin/cc symlink. You can fix it like this: cd /usr/bin ln -s gcc cc
If that doesn't do it, check the file config.log created by configure. Errors go there and may indicate the problem.
